INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The paper shown an interesting research to a diagnosis system that will can localize and classify the corrosion process in response to electrical signals applied to the rod terminal that emerges from the soil. It was developed special hardware to make specific connections to allow a network analyzer to apply and receive high frequency signals on these rods. The localization of the corrosion point was performed by signals time domain analysis and its intensity will be inferred by neural network analysis.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The paper shown an interesting research to a diagnosis system that will can localize and classify the corrosion process in response to electrical signals applied to the rod terminal that emerges from the soil. It was developed special hardware to make specific connections to allow a network analyzer to apply and receive high frequency signals on these rods. The localization of the corrosion point was performed by signals time domain analysis and its intensity will be inferred by neural network analysis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta o projeto, simulação e me-dição para um arranjo de antenas controladas por fase utiliza-do em um sistema de supervisão para redes de distribuição de energia elétrica. O sistema é capaz de controlar a direção do lóbulo principal, aumentando a densidade de potência em uma direção desejada, melhorando a comunicação com uma estação remota e reduzindo áreas de sombra. Simulações em laborató-rio, testes em campo e a instalação do sistema em uma Subesta-ção são exibidos.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a practical implementation of a S-Band 4-bit Digital Instantaneous Frequency Measurement Subsystem based on microstrip multibandstop filters. The outputs are converted using RF detectors and digitized using an Arduino® board. Filter design is based on open-loop resonators. Sub-band is determined by calculating the average value of m measures and standard deviation is used to further improve reliability. This paper discusses the key requirements for this design and presents experimental results for the sub-band determination.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a practical implementation of a S-Band 4-bit Digital Instantaneous Frequency Measurement Subsystem based on microstrip multibandstop filters. The outputs are converted using RF detectors and digitized using an Arduino® board. Filter design is based on open-loop resonators. Sub-band is determined by calculating the average value of m measures and standard deviation is used to further improve reliability. This paper discusses the key requirements for this design and presents experimental results for the sub-band determination.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The authors present a novel compact 3-bit interferometer based on Hilbert fractal geometry for application to Instantaneous Frequency Measurement (IFM) system operating in the range 4.66-6.38 GHz. The interferometers use two-way Wilkinson power dividers connected to two microstrip line with different signal delays, where one of these microstrip lines is based on Hilbert fractal curve. A full wave EM simulator is used to obtain the frequency response. Simulated responses are presented and compared to theoretical results.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The authors present a novel compact 3-bit interferometer based on Hilbert fractal geometry for application to Instantaneous Frequency Measurement (IFM) system operating in the range 4.66-6.38 GHz. The interferometers use two-way Wilkinson power dividers connected to two microstrip line with different signal delays, where one of these microstrip lines is based on Hilbert fractal curve. A full wave EM simulator is used to obtain the frequency response. Simulated responses are presented and compared to theoretical results.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work shows the measurements of electric
fields generated by power line communications (PLC) under
transmission lines. The values are compared to simulated results
obtained by the electric field equations developed by D?Amore. As
a contribution, the electric field equations employ measured soil
electrical parameters (conductivity and permittivity) under the
transmission lines by the authors. Through the antenna theory is
presented an already developed method that allow the dBm values
obtained by the spectrum analyzer be converted into dBmV/m.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper reports a new method for reducing the
Radar Cross-Section (RCS) of a metal backed dipole antenna.
Numerical simulations are used to show that when the Perfect
Electrical Conductor (PEC) is replaced by a carefully designed
Frequency Selective Surface (FSS), the electromagnetic performance
of the antenna is similar in band, but the RCS of the
structure is significantly lower out of band. The design of the FSS
and the return loss, radiation patterns and RCS are presented
for an antenna which operates at a center frequency of 4 GHz
and the results are compared with a conventional metal backed
arrangement

INVITED PAPER

This paper discusses key issues related to the
design of large processing volume chip architectures and high
speed system interconnects. Design methodologies and techniques
are discussed, where recent trends and considerations are
highlighted.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Anchor rods have been used to lash down guyed
cables in telecommunications and power transmission lines. The
ones can be buried or encased in concrete below-ground. Electric
power companies perform inspections on their anchor rods
through invasive techniques to analyze the corrosion levels. A
promising nondestructive technique based on a FDR method has
been developed to measure the rods condition. A high frequency
connector was designed to plug a network analyzer to the anchor
rods. An impedance matching circuit was designed and it must be
used between the connector and this instrument. Simulated and
experimental results are presented for the matching circuit, and
laboratory tests are shown, where it was plugged to the high
frequency connector and a one-meter anchor rod.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The transfer function of electrical power lines for
Broadband Power Line Communication (BPLC) is investigated
through a signal-flow graph analysis. The work intends to present
a new, simple and didactic way to model the transfer function of a
multi-path model, in which the attenuation losses are taken into
account. The results are compared to the transfer function
obtained by the ABCD model. Measurements on coax cables and
electrical grids are presented and the results are investigated.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents a building block approach for
the design of frequency identification receivers. The devices are
based on a Reconfigurable Discriminator (RD) for frequency
measurement, operating from 1 to 4 GHz. The RD is a two-port
device used to identify the frequency of an unknown signal. The
devices use RF switches, which are implemented with PIN diodes
to select different bits used for frequency identification.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A sensor system for local detection and remote location of electric discharges on overhead power transmission lines was designed, fabricated and tested. This system detects the presence of an electric discharge and measures the peak value of the electric current of it. For this, a Rogowski coil and some dedicated electronic circuits should be installed on a truss element of each tower as a bracing or leg. At the remote location, the sensor system should inform to a remote receiving point which tower or span was struck by an electric discharge. A radiofrequency system was implemented to send the measurement data relative to the peak value of the discharge current on each tower. Thus, the electric company will be able to locate the tower where was presented the biggest discharge electric current peak, and will provide the right maintenance.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A sensor system for local detection and remote location of electric discharges on overhead power transmission lines was designed, fabricated and tested. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The article presents a literature review of
grounding protection systems used on a subtransmission
line of 138kV. By means of simulations, the objective is to
prove the effectiveness of the proposed system, used by
CELPE, and determine how the parameters used in the
protection system were defined.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Modificações na geometria da Cruz de Jerusalém
(CJ) são aqui investigadas para o projeto de superfícies seletivas
em frequência (Frequency Seletive Frequency - FSS) multibandas.
As geometrias propostas são obtidas pela introdução de quatro
stubs com a mesma disposição dos stubs da estrutura original tal
que sucessivas iterações possam ser obtidas. Na FSS da Cruz de
Jerusalém os dipolos são responsáveis pela primeira frequência
de ressonância e os stubs pela segunda. A introdução de novos
stubs possibilita o aparecimento de novas bandas proporcionais
ao seu comprimento. Três iterações da FSS proposta são
estudadas neste artigo, e resultados de simulação para o
parâmetro de espalhamento S21, e distribuição da corrente de
superfície são aqui apresentados. Os resultados mostram que
cada iteração acrescenta uma nova frequência de ressonância,
sendo assim a terceira iteração fornece cinco bandas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Changes in the geometry of the Jerusalem Cross
(CJ) are investigated here for the design of selective surfaces
in frequency (Frequency Frequency seletive - FSS) Multiband.
The proposed geometries are obtained by the introduction of four
stubs with the same arrangement of the stubs of the original structure such
successive iterations it may be obtained. In the FSS Cross
Jerusalem dipoles are responsible for the first frequency
resonance and stubs for the second. The introduction of new
stubs enables the appearance of new bands proportionate
to its length. Three iterations of the FSS proposal are
studied in this article, and simulation results for
S21 scattering parameter, and distribution of current
surface are presented here. The results show that
each iteration adds a new resonance frequency,
thus the third iteration provides five bands.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper discusses the use of multi-band-stop filters
for application as frequency discriminators. A novel design method is
presented (multi-band-stop filters based on the balanced gray code)
and compared to the straightforward method (traditional gray code).
The novel method increases individual rejected bands fractional
bandwidth, while assuring that each filter possess the same amount of
rejected sub-bands. For a frequency span, it is also shown that the
sub-bands fractional bandwidth relative standard deviation is
reduced.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
detection of microwave signals in the battlefield or 
surveillance zone allows identifying enemy outposts, which may 
include radar or communications transmitters. This paper 
describes the techniques required to identify the frequency of 
unknown detected signals and the estimation of their incoming 
direction using unmanned aerial vehicles.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents a comparison between fixed and 
reconfigurable 4-bit microwave discriminators. The fixed 
discriminator is implemented by using multi-band-stop filters to 
define bits used for frequency identification. The reconfigurable 
discriminator is implemented by using delay lines and two SPQT 
switches. Both designs operate at L and S bands, a comparison 
between both devices is provided,including simulated and measured 
responses for both designs
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

switches. Both designs operate at L and S bands, a comparison

responses for both designs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work presents the design, simulation,
fabrication and measurement of a novel set of microstrip filters
to perform the task of frequency discriminators. These filters?
frequency responses are based on the balanced Gray-code.
Results show that the use of the balanced Gray-code, as opposed
to the traditional Gray-code, allowed 20% circuit size reduction
by using 60% less resonators due to a change in the resonators?
orientation.

by using 60% less resonators due to a change in the resonators?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: this paper presents a microstrip antenna with controlled gain and directivity. The gain control of antenna is achieved by employing a Reconfigurable Frequency Selective Surface (RFSS) as superstrate which is formed by 2 x 2 array of square loops. The RFSS resonance is variable and depends on the PIN diodes biasing. When all diodes are in the ON-state, the RFSS resonates at 1.89 GHz, and at 3.00 GHz when the diodes are in the OFF-state. It influences the antenna behavior which operates at 2.40 GHz. Analyses of the simulated antenna gain, radiation pattern and return loss are shown. The gain improvement depends on the PIN diodes biasing. The improvement is 2.95 dB and reduction is 6.95 dB at 2.40 GHz for reverse and forward bias, respectively. At reverse bias, the main lobe is in the opposite direction comparing to the forward bias.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: this paper presents a microstrip antenna with controlled gain and directivity. The gain control of antenna is achieved by employing a Reconfigurable Frequency Selective Surface (RFSS) as superstrate which is formed by 2 x 2 array of square loops. The RFSS resonance is variable and depends on the PIN diodes biasing. When all diodes are in the ON-state, the RFSS resonates at 1.89 GHz, and at 3.00 GHz when the diodes are in the OFF-state. It influences the antenna behavior which operates at 2.40 GHz. Analyses of the simulated antenna gain, radiation pattern and return loss are shown. The gain improvement depends on the PIN diodes biasing. The improvement is 2.95 dB and reduction is 6.95 dB at 2.40 GHz for reverse and forward bias, respectively. At reverse bias, the main lobe is in the opposite direction comparing to the forward bias.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Filtena Reconfigurável usando Diodo Varactor para Aplicações em Sistemas IoT
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: 77/5000 Filtena Reconfigurable using Varactor Diode for Applications in IoT Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do MOMAG 2018

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta uma nova filtena reconfigurável para aplicações em sistemas IoT. A filtena é composta por uma antena microfita com patch circular UWB e um filtro com geometria trapezoidal. O filtro corresponde a um passabanda e está localizado na linha de alimentação da antena. A reconfiguração da filtena é realizada através de um diodo varactor presente no filtro cuja capacitância varia de 2pF a 50pF. Tais valores de capacitância permitem a variação na frequência de operação do dispositivo. A frequência de operação é sintonizada na faixa de 1,66 GHz a 2,4 GHz, mantendo o diagrama de radiação da antena UWB base. Resultados para perda de retorno e diagrama de radiação são mostrados.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article presents a new reconfigurable filter for applications in IoT systems. The filtena is composed by a microfita antenna with circular patch UWB and a filter with trapezoidal geometry. The filter is a passband and is located on the antenna power line. The reconfiguration of the filter is carried out through a varactor diode present in the filter whose capacitance varies from 2pF to 50pF. Such capacitance values allow for variation in the operating frequency of the device. The operating frequency is tuned in the range of 1.66 GHz to 2.4 GHz, keeping the radiation pattern of the base UWB antenna. Results for return loss and radiation pattern are shown.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sensor planar baseado na geometria fractal de Hilbert
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Planar sensor based on Hilbert fractal geometry

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: MOMAG 2018
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do MOMAG 2018

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Neste artigo é apresentado um sensor de microondas para caracterização de materiais. O fractal de Hilbert é usado como ressoador devido à grande área capacitiva associada à estrutura. Esse sensor tem característica de resposta multibanda 0com três polos na faixa de 0,1 GHz a 4,5 GHz. O primeiro polo f1
= 0.8 GHz tem uma sensibilidade de 21,6 MHz/Fm-1 , o Segundo polo f2 = 2.36 GHz de 53,7 MHz/Fm-1
e o terceiro polo f3 = 3.84 GHz de 94,5 MHz/Fm-1 , para uma amostra variando de 1 a 10 Fm1
. O primeiro polo também é usado para medir amostras com permissividade de 10 a 80 Fm-1
. Software de onda completa foi usado para obter as perdas de inserção do sensor com e sem
amostras.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
680/5000
In this paper we present a microwave sensor for characterization of materials. The Hilbert fractal is used as a resonator because of the large capacitive area associated with the structure. This sensor has multiband response 0 with three poles in the range of 0.1 GHz to 4.5 GHz. The first pole f1
= 0.8 GHz has a sensitivity of 21.6 MHz / Fm-1, the second pole f2 = 2.36 GHz of 53.7 MHz / Fm-1
and the third pole f3 = 3.84 GHz of 94.5 MHz / Fm-1, for a sample ranging from 1 to 10 Fm1
. The first pole is also used to measure samples with a permittivity of 10 to 80 Fm-1
. Full wave software was used to obtain sensor insertion losses with and without
samples.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sensor de Micro­ondas para Caracterização de Solos através da Permissividade Elétrica
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Microwave Sensor for Soil Characterization through Electrical Permissivity

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Lauro R. G. S. L. Novo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A agropecuária carece de monitoramento constante das condições do solo, sendo o nível de umidade do solo um dos parâmetros relevantes para o correto gerenciamento dessa prática, especialmente em regiões áridas. Sensores de umidade de micro-ondas são uma opção segura para o fornecimento de valores precisos de umidade. Neste trabalho, um cabo coaxial caracterizador de permissividade complexa relativa de solo é proposto. Esse dispositivo foi projetado computacionalmente e teve sua matriz de impedância levantada. De posse dessa matriz foi possível determinar a permissividade de amostras de solo depositadas dentro do cabo coaxial construído. Os resultados foram próximos dos valores teóricas dos quatro solos analisados com a ressalva de que os solos mais úmidos apresentaram maior discrepância entre valores simulados e teóricos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Agriculture has no constant monitoring of soil conditions, and the soil moisture level is one of the relevant parameters for the correct management of this practice, especially in arid regions. Microwave moisture sensors are a safe option for providing accurate humidity values. In this work, a coaxial cable characterizing relative permissivity of soil is proposed. This device was designed computationally and had its impedance matrix raised. With this matrix, it was possible to determine the permissiveness of soil samples deposited within the coaxial cable. The results were close to the theoretical values of the four soils analyzed with the proviso that the moist soils presented greater discrepancy between simulated and theoretical values.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
reproduced, where it is used an amplifier to increase
the antenna gain. Enhanced gain of the antenna is achieved by
employing an FSS as superstrate that is formed by the 2 x 2
array of triangular loops. The antenna operates at 1.73 GHz,
and the distance between the antenna and superstrate is 30
mm. The superstrate influence on the antenna behavior is
analyzed. The gain improvement depends on the resonance of
the FSS superstrate, and the antenna gain increased from 3 to

resonant frequency. Thus, one proposes a FSS that can
improve the antenna gain presented without using active
devices.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this paper, a new FSS unit cell geometry is
presented. Pairs of vertical and horizontal slot dipoles are used to
create an orientation-insensitive multiband pass frequency
response. The proposed structure operates in the C-band (4-6
GHz) and X-band (8-12GHz) and presents ten resonant
frequencies. Since each passband is independent, this geometry is
suited for application as chipless orientation-insensitive RFID
tags. The S21 simulation results are present and were carried out
by CST Microwave Studio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper, an Equivalent Circuit Method (ECM) is used for analyzing the Modified Jerusalem Cross Frequency Selective Surfaces (MJC-FSS). The method consists in estimating the frequency response of an FSS by calculating the inductive reactances and capacitive susceptibilities related to the structure. To validate the results, insertion loss (S21) were performed using a 3D full-wave electromagnetic simulation software.

The method consists in estimating the frequency response of an FSS by calculating the inductive reactances and capacitive susceptibilities related to the structure. To validate the results, insertion loss (S21) were performed using a 3D full-wave electromagnetic simulation software.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this paper, a study related to the unloaded
quality factor Q0 of a resonant cavity using rectangular
waveguide technology is described. The resonator operates
at Q band (33 - 50 GHz) with a central frequency of 41,5
GHz, with two ports. Simulations are done using Ansys
HFSS. The results obtained with copper show a high unload
quality factor Q0.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: automação de um sistema de microondas para caracterização de filmes finos supercondutores

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VI congresso de inicição científica da UFPE

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Caracterizar filmes supercondutores utilizando a técnica de ressoador de microfita. Para tanto será necessário, inicialmente estudar os conceitos básicos das equações de Maxwell e aplicações com ressoadores coplanares. Investigar os limites da dimensionalidade do ressoador como um todo, a espessura do substrato, espessura do filme, a largura de linha do ressoador como também as características elétricas do substrato e do filme. Com a investigação detalhada desses parâmetros poderá se identificar valores tanto de Resistência intrínseca e Resistência efetiva de superfície dos filmes depositados. Estes resultados serão imprescindíveis no processo de seleção do filme. O aluno aprenderá a cortar substrato que possam ser utilizados para deposição do filmes supercondutores com o mínimo efeito de borda. Em paralelo irá desenvolver um equipamento que possa cortar a seco os substratos de MgO com filmes depositados. Caberá ao aluno medir os parâmetros de espalhamento do ressoador supercondutor num processo de transmissão e convertelos em valores de resistência de superfícies. O sistema de microondas a ser utilizado composto pelos seguintes equipamentos: Um analisador de rede modelo HP8410A com o módulo display de amplitude e fase HP8412A, uma unidade de teste para transmissão e reflexão HP8743A, um gerador de microondas de varredura HP 8690B, um osciloscópio digital Tektronix Tds 360 de 200MHz e um microcomputador pentium
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Characterize superconducting films using the micronite resonator technique. To do so, it will first be necessary to study the basic concepts of Maxwell's equations and applications with coplanar resonators. Investigate the limits of the resonator dimensionality as a whole, the substrate thickness, film thickness, resonator line width as well as the electrical characteristics of the substrate and film. With the detailed investigation of these parameters it will be possible to identify values ​​of both intrinsic resistance and effective surface resistance of the deposited films. These results will be essential in the movie selection process. The student will learn how to cut substrate that can be used for superconducting film deposition with minimal edge effect. In parallel, it will develop equipment that can dry cut MgO substrates with deposited films. It will be up to the student to measure the spreading parameters of the superconducting resonator in a transmission process and convert them to surface resistance values. The microwave system to be used consists of the following equipment: An HP8410A network analyzer with the HP8412A phase and amplitude display module, an HP8743A reflection and transmission test unit, an HP 8690B raster microwave generator, a digital oscilloscope Tektronix Tds 360 200MHz and a Pentium Microcomputer

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LOTT NETO, H. B. D. T.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Anchor rods are used to fix the guy cables of
transmission towers into the soil. Thus, anchor rods are buried
or encapsulated in concrete beneath the ground, thereby forming
a reliable support system. However, incomplete or imperfect
anchor grouting often occurs during construction, which may
cause the anchor to become ineffective and lead to engineering
accidents. Therefore, such anchors require periodic maintenance.
Frequency domain reflectometry is used to locate and quantize
possible deterioration on the concrete anchors. Experimental
results have shown that the reflectometry approach may be a
new method for the noninvasive maintenance of anchor rods
measuring one meter.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

new method for the noninvasive maintenance of anchor rods
measuring one meter.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents a new methodology based on
a FDR technique and machine learning structure to detect faults
on anchor rods used in guyed towers of power transmission
lines. Such faults are due to material loss in the rods, which it
may lead to rupture of them, and possible falling tower. The
methodology is a non-destructive technique (NDT) was based on
frequency domain reflectometry (FDR). For detection, high
frequency pulses are inserted into anchor rod samples and the
reflection coefficient is analyzed and compaired to that obtained
in the simulation results. Samples of anchor rods with and
without faults were simulated, fabricated, measured and
classified by a machine learning structure to determine the
presence or absence of the faults on each of them.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

frequency domain reflectometry (FDR). For detection, high

presence or absence of the faults on each of them.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper reviews the microwave interference
technique applied to interferometers for frequency
measurement and filters. The microwave interference takes
place when a signal passes through two different paths and then
recombined to produce an interference pattern. Path length
defines interference curve maximum and minimum, calculated
to obtain the desired device frequency response. Reconfigurable
interferometers, including wide-band and dual-band filters
designed using interference patterns are described in this paper.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

designed using interference patterns are described in this paper.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Network parameters are capable of conveying information about the constitution of a medium in which a high-frequency wave propagates. In this paper, this characteristic is exploited in order to design a nondestructive system to detect corrosion in anchor rods of guyed towers. A compound database is built with the simulated and measured parameters return loss, input impedance, and voltage standing wave ratio for normal and faulty rods examples. Artificial neural networks are used to capture underlying characteristics of data and establish relationships between these parameters and the presence of corrosion in the rods, without the need for physical models. Experimental results show that the innovative use of a multi-parameter strategy achieves a high
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Network parameters are capable of conveying information about the constitution of a medium in which a high-frequency wave propagates. In this paper, this characteristic is exploited in order to design a nondestructive system to detect corrosion in anchor rods of guyed towers. A compound database is built with the simulated and measured parameters return loss, input impedance, and voltage standing wave ratio for normal and faulty rods examples. Artificial neural networks are used to capture underlying characteristics of data and establish relationships between these parameters and the presence of corrosion in the rods, without the need for physical models. Experimental results show that the innovative use of a multi-parameter strategy achieves a high

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A New Trapezium FSS Superstrate for Antenna Gain E nhancement
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A New Trapezium FSS Superstrate for Antenna Gain E nhancement

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper proposed a new frequency selective surface (FSS) for antenna gain enhancement. The antenna and FSS have an isosceles trapezium geometry. Three different versions of an antenna were created. For each version, the S-parameters S11 and S21 were simulated with the software CST Microwave Studio®. Then, one of the three trapezoid antennas was simulated with an FSS. These two devices, antenna and FSS, were manufactured and had the S11 and S21 parameters measured in laboratory. The resonance frequency obtained for the trapezium FSS was equal to 2.27 GHz for α equal to 0 °, 2.70 GHz for α equal to 15 ° and 3.12 GHz for α equal to 30 °. The antenna?s gain were also simulated and measured. The gain increased when the FSS was used as superstrate. Without the presence of FSS a maximum gain of approximately 1.50 db occurs in 2.20 GHz, when placed the FSS as superstrate the gain increases to approximately 5.25 db. The measured results agreed with the simulated results.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper proposed a new frequency selective surface (FSS) for antenna gain enhancement. The antenna and FSS have an isosceles trapezium geometry. Three different versions of an antenna were created. These two devices, antenna and FSS, were manufactured and had the S11 and S21 parameters measured in laboratory. Without the presence of FSS a maximum gain of approximately 1.50 db occurs in 2.20 GHz, when placed the FSS as superstrate the gain increases to approximately 5.25 db. The measured results agreed with the simulated results.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a fractal Frequency Selective Surface (FSS) based on the fractal geometry, for radar systems applications. The third iteration of Sierpinski curve fractal geometry is used to design the FSS. The Sierpinski curve has a space-filling propriety to miniaturize the FSS. The device presents a dual-polarized behavior and two stop-band response at 1.82 GHz and 4.79 GHz, which are suitable for interference protection applications. The L and C bands are filtered avoiding eventual adjacent interference with S band frequency. Additionally, an investigation is performed for different polarized wave incidence. The simulation frequency responses are performed using ANSYS HFSS software. The simulation and measurement results are shown and compared for validation purposes.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work presents a fractal Frequency Selective Surface (FSS) based on the fractal geometry, for radar systems applications. The third iteration of Sierpinski curve fractal geometry is used to design the FSS. The Sierpinski curve has a space-filling propriety to miniaturize the FSS. The device presents a dual-polarized behavior and two stop-band response at 1.82 GHz and 4.79 GHz, which are suitable for interference protection applications. The L and C bands are filtered avoiding eventual adjacent interference with S band frequency. Additionally, an investigation is performed for different polarized wave incidence. The simulation frequency responses are performed using ANSYS HFSS software. The simulation and measurement results are shown and compared for validation purposes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work presents the modeling and mathematical
analysis of a back-to-back double antenna array with 360◦
coverage. The Double Array is composed by 8 Yagi-Uda antennas
aligned in two back-to-back 4-element linear arrays. The goal of
this work is verifying the influence of the separation between the
two arrays in the farfield radiation diagram regarding shape and
directivity. Simulated results are presented.

analysis of a back-to-back double antenna array with 360◦
coverage. The Double Array is composed by 8 Yagi-Uda antennas

this work is verifying the influence of the separation between the
two arrays in the farfield radiation diagram regarding shape and
directivity. Simulated results are presented.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: material nas hastes de âncora utilizadas na fixação dos estais em torres estaiadas de linhas de transmissão de energia. Estas falhas podem ocasionar a queda das torres de transmissão, resultando em acidentes e danos à população, e consequentemente gerando punições financeiras expressivas por parte dos órgãos fiscalizadores junto às empresas transmissoras. A metodologia deste sistema foi baseada em um método não destrutivo com o uso de reflectometria no domínio da frequência. Um conector de altas frequências foi projetado para realizar a interface entre o instrumento (analisador de redes vetorial portátil) e a haste de âncora. A medição, a partir do analisador de redes e conector supracitado, injeta pulsos de alta frequência os quais trafegam pela haste, e as reflexões medidas no ponto de inserção dos sinais modela o comportamento do coeficiente de reflexão neste ponto. Esta resposta é analisada e comparada àquela obtida da respectiva simulação. Amostras de hastes de âncora com diferentes comprimentos e distintos perfis de falhas foram testadas e analisadas, e os resultados foram utilizados para validação da metodologia proposta.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: material on the anchor rods used to fix the posts in cable-stayed towers of power transmission lines. These failures can cause the transmission towers to fall, resulting in accidents and damage to the population, and consequently generating significant financial penalties by the inspection agencies with the transmission companies. The methodology of this system was based on a non-destructive method with the use of reflectometry in the frequency domain. A high frequency connector was designed to interface the instrument (portable vector network analyzer) and the anchor rod. The measurement, using the network analyzer and the aforementioned connector, injects high-frequency pulses which travel through the rod, and the reflections measured at the point of insertion of the signals models the behavior of the reflection coefficient at this point. This response is analyzed and compared to that obtained from the respective simulation. Samples of anchor rods with different lengths and different failure profiles were tested and analyzed, and the results were used to validate the proposed methodology.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ARQUITETURA DE REDE NEURAL ARTIFICIAL PARA DETECÇÃO DE FALHAS ESTRUTURAIS EM HASTES DE ÂNCORA DE TORRES ESTAIADAS DE LINHAS DE TRANSMISSÃO DE ENERGIA ELÉTRICA para validação da metodologia proposta.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORK ARCHITECTURE FOR DETECTION OF STRUCTURAL FAILURES IN STEEL ANCHOR STEMS ESTABLISHED FROM ELECTRICITY TRANSMISSION LINES

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta um classificador binário que utiliza aprendizado de máquina para detecção de falhas estruturais em hastes de âncora de torres estaiadas de linhas de transmissão de energia elétrica. O diagnóstico é realizado através da análise das respostas em frequência do parâmetro de espalhamento |S11| por uma rede neural artificial treinada a reconhecer e diferenciar os padrões dos sinais medidos em hastes normais e defeituosas. O sistema opera com uma base de dados que não requer métodos invasivos ou de alto custo operacional para aquisição dos sinais e foi desenvolvido em ferramentas de código aberto, apresentando alto nível de desempenho associado a uma baixa carga computacional.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work presents a binary classifier that uses machine learning to detect structural faults in anode stems of staked towers of electric power transmission lines. The diagnosis is made by analyzing the frequency responses of the spreading parameter | S11 | by an artificial neural network trained to recognize and differentiate the patterns of the signals measured in normal and defective stems. The system operates with a database that does not require invasive methods or high operating costs for signal acquisition and was developed in open source tools, presenting a high level of performance associated with a low computational load.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Otimização da Técnica de Reflectometria pelo Algoritmo PSO na Localização de Falhas em Haste
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Optimization of the Reflectometry Technique by the PSO Algorithm in the Stem Fault Location

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As hastes de âncora são estruturas metálicas utilizadas para fixar no solo os estais de torres de transmissão de energia elétrica. O método empregado para manutenção preventiva e substituição destas hastes é a inspeção visual. A técnica proposta para avaliar falhas estruturais nas hastes é não-destrutiva, e baseada na reflectometria no domínio da frequência (FDR). A identificação de falhas muito pequenas a partir das respostas da FDR é complexa devido a possibilidade de estas serem confundidas com demais estruturas da ancoragem. O algoritmo de Otimização por Enxames de Partículas (PSO) foi utilizado nos dados das medições FDR para realçar as respostas associadas às falhas nas hastes, o qual inseriu um ganho médio relativo de aproximadamente 90% nos valores de VSWR na região do desgaste na haste.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Anchor rods are metal structures used to fix the electrical transmission towers to the ground. The method used for preventive maintenance and replacement of these rods is visual inspection. The proposed technique for evaluating structural flaws in the nails is non-destructive, and based on reflectometry in the frequency domain (FDR). The identification of very small faults from the FDR's responses is complex due to the possibility that they may be confused with other anchoring structures. The Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) algorithm was used in the FDR measurement data to highlight the responses associated with stem failures, which inserted a relative average gain of approximately 90% in the VSWR values in the stem wear region.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Filtro em Guia de Onda para Sistemas de Medição Instantânea de Frequências

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: MOMAG 2020
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: ANAIS DO MOMAG 2020

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um novo design de filtro para sistemas de medição instantânea de frequências é apresentado neste trabalho. Os filtros são compostos por cavidades ressoadores conectados ao guia de onda por meio de uma íris. Cada cavidade ressoa em uma frequência distinta que combinadas formam a resposta em frequência desejada para o sistema IFM. O sistema proposto é de dois bits e apresenta quatro sub-bandas na faixa de 14,96 GHz a 15,13 GHz. A modelagem e a simulação das estruturas proposta foram realizadas através de um software de simulação eletromagnética 3D, e suas respostas em frequências são aqui apresentadas e comentadas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A new filter design for instantaneous frequency measurement systems is presented in this work. The filters are composed of resonant cavities connected to the waveguide by means of an iris. Each cavity resonates at a different frequency which, combined, form the desired frequency response for the IFM system. The proposed system is two bits and has four sub-bands in the range of 14.96 GHz to 15.13 GHz. The modeling and simulation of the proposed structures were performed using 3D electromagnetic simulation software, and their frequency responses are presented and commented on here.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sensor em Microfita para Detecc¸ ?ao de Hidrog?enio em Frequ?encias de Micro-ondas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Este artigo descreve a construc¸ ?ao de um dispositivo capaz de detectar hidrog?enio usando estruturas simples de microondas. Como o uso de hidrog?enio est´a crescendo em diversas
´areas, devido `a grande liberac¸ ?ao de energia na sua queima, ´e importante que esse g´as seja detectado em tempo h´abil, uma vez que ele possui baixo limite explosivo. A estrutura escolhida para a construc¸ ?ao do sensor foi a linha de microfita, que antes de ser constru´ıda foi otimizada em um ambiente de simulac¸ ?ao virtual. Ap´os a fabricac¸ ?ao, a detecc¸ ?ao foi realizada pela observac¸ ?ao da variac¸ ?ao na amplitude do sinal propagado em estruturas h´ıbridas de micro-ondas em microfita composta de segmentos
longitudinais de cobre e pal´adio. Observou-se uma variac¸ ?ao de 18% na amplitude do sinal transmitido pela microfita quando exposta a uma concentrac¸ ?ao de 4% de hidrog?enio em 96% de
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This article describes the construction of a device
capable of detecting hydrogen using simple microwave structures.
As the use of hydrogen is growing in several
Areas, due to the great release of energy in its burning, it is
important that this gas is detected in a timely manner, once
that it has a low explosive limit. The structure chosen for
the construction of the sensor was the microfiche line, which before being
constructed was optimized in a virtual simulation environment.
After manufacture, detection was carried out by observing
of the variation in the amplitude of the signal propagated in structures
microwaves of microwaves composed of segments
longitudinal copper and palladium. There was a variation of
18% in the amplitude of the signal transmitted by the microfiche when
exposed to a concentration of 4% hydrogen in 96%
nitrogen.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A new technique to cancel additional phase shifts of two-port resonant devices
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A new technique to cancel additional phase shifts of two-port resonant devices

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Anais do Momag2020
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: ANAIS DO MOMAG 2020

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper proposes a new way to obtain and cancel additional phases shifts that derive from non-ideal effects, and are added to the S-parameters of coupled resonant structures. For this purpose, it is defined an error function whose minimization leads to finding the additional phases. This way, the phase corrected S-parameters can be used to obtain a valid rational model for the structure response and extract its coupling matrix for purposes of computer-aided-tuning. This method is applicable to lossy or lossless networks of two ports composed of coupled resonators such as microwave filters. In addition, it is free of limiting elements inherent to the other solutions already existing in the literature and has the advantage of not requiring S parameters in a frequency range much higher than the filter band. Examples including simulations of microwaves passband filters are given in order to demonstrate the functionality of the new technique.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper proposes a new way to obtain and cancel additional phases shifts that derive from non-ideal effects, and are added to the S-parameters of coupled resonant structures. For this purpose, it is defined an error function whose minimization leads to finding the additional phases. This way, the phase corrected S-parameters can be used to obtain a valid rational model for the structure response and extract its coupling matrix for purposes of computer-aided-tuning. This method is applicable to lossy or lossless networks of two ports composed of coupled resonators such as microwave filters. In addition, it is free of limiting elements inherent to the other solutions already existing in the literature and has the advantage of not requiring S parameters in a frequency range much higher than the filter band. Examples including simulations of microwaves passband filters are given in order to demonstrate the functionality of the new technique.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Modelagem eletromagnética da ancoragem de torres transmissoras de energia elétrica
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Electromagnetic modeling of the anchoring of electric power transmission towers

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Lauro R. G. S. L. Novo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo propõe uma abordagem alternativa para a modelagem eletromagnética da ancoragem de torres estaiadas de linhas de transmissão de energia elétrica, empregando a técnica de reflectometria no domínio da frequência. A modelagem proposta utiliza a Teoria de Ondas Viajantes, matrizes ABCD, parâmetros de espalhamento, e simulação 3D. Sua aplicação visa auxiliar um sistema diagnóstico para a detecção de corrosões em hastes de ancoragem, e revelou-se célere na obtenção dos sinais de parâmetros S comparativamente às simulações 3D tradicionais, mostrando-se uma ferramenta capaz de otimizar consideravelmente o tempo de elaboração do banco de dados de sinais do sistema para os mais diferentes perfis de corrosão das hastes de âncora.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article proposes an alternative approach to the electromagnetic modeling of the anchoring of cable-stayed towers of electric power transmission lines, using the reflectometry technique in the frequency domain. The proposed modeling uses the Traveling Wave Theory, ABCD matrices, scattering parameters, and 3D simulation. Its application aims to assist a diagnostic system for the detection of corrosion in anchor rods, and has proved to be quick in obtaining the S-parameter signals compared to traditional 3D simulations, showing itself to be a tool capable of considerably optimizing the bank's elaboration time system signal data for the most different corrosion profiles of the anchor rods.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Chave SPDT por ressoadores acoplados de malha aberta para a banda de UHF
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: SPDT switch by coupled open loop resonators for the UHF band

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Anais do Momag2020
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: ANAIS DO MOMAG 2020

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo descreve uma chave SPDT (Single-Pole-Double-Throw), de três acessos, em tecnologia de microfita e formada por três ressoadores. Ela é composta da junção de dois filtros SPST (Single-Pole-Single-Throw), projetados em ressoadores quadrados de malha aberta, acoplados, e que são usualmente empregados em filtros passa-faixa de banda estreita. A partir da teoria de acoplamento, e combinando dois desses filtros SPST, uma chave SPDT é aqui descrita e resultados de simulações são apresentados, revelando isolamento melhor do que -48 dB e perda de inserção máxima de -0,65 dB para a faixa de frequência de 459 MHz - 469 MHz.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article describes a SPDT (Single-Pole-Double-Throw) switch, with three accesses, in microfiber technology and formed by three resonators. It consists of the junction of two SPST filters (Single-Pole-Single-Throw), designed in coupled open-loop square resonators, which are usually used in narrowband bandpass filters. From the coupling theory, and combining two of these SPST filters, an SPDT switch is described here and simulation results are presented, revealing better insulation than -48 dB and maximum insertion loss of -0.65 dB for the range of 459 MHz - 469 MHz frequency.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A novel iterative method to estimate the soil complex permittivity from measurement and simulation modeling

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: LOTT NETO, H. B. D. T.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper introduces a new strategy to determine the soil permittivity and its loss tangent which uses simulation and measurement result for comparison. The setup of the measurement system includes a high frequency connector and a two-rod transmission line (TRTL) where one of the rods is embedded in an unknown-permittivity soil. In order to validate the simulation model by optimizing the complex permittivity of the soil from the measurement result a smart searching tool performed by the PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization) algorithm is applied. The measurements were carried out by a VNA (Vector Network Analyzer) to obtain the reflected signals from the TRTL for a non-parameterized soil. The effectiveness of the PSO algorithm is demonstrated by equalizing both simulated and measurement results of the soil complex permittivity in the simulation model.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper introduces a new strategy to determine the soil permittivity and its loss tangent which uses simulation and measurement result for comparison. The setup of the measurement system includes a high frequency connector and a two-rod transmission line (TRTL) where one of the rods is embedded in an unknown-permittivity soil. In order to validate the simulation model by optimizing the complex permittivity of the soil from the measurement result a smart searching tool performed by the PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization) algorithm is applied. The measurements were carried out by a VNA (Vector Network Analyzer) to obtain the reflected signals from the TRTL for a non-parameterized soil. The effectiveness of the PSO algorithm is demonstrated by equalizing both simulated and measurement results of the soil complex permittivity in the simulation model.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Eye bolts are critical elements of the electrical power distribution systems and structural failures on such devices can lead to service interruption, financial losses and hazard to civilians. Due to their installation characteristics, their common maintenance routine is costly, time-consuming and ineffective, because it depends on the de-energization of the circuit, disassembly and visual inspection of the bolts. In this paper, a new approach for detecting structural failures on eye bolts is proposed. An intelligent system based on an artificial neural network is used to process the reflectometry signals measured in order to detect the condition of the eye bolt automatically. The high accuracy in the experimental results suggests that the method proposed can improve the efficiency of the preventive maintenance routine performed on eye bolts, and, consequently, increase the reliability of the power distribution systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Eye bolts are critical elements of the electrical power distribution systems and structural failures on such devices can lead to service interruption, financial losses and hazard to civilians. Due to their installation characteristics, their common maintenance routine is costly, time-consuming and ineffective, because it depends on the de-energization of the circuit, disassembly and visual inspection of the bolts. In this paper, a new approach for detecting structural failures on eye bolts is proposed. An intelligent system based on an artificial neural network is used to process the reflectometry signals measured in order to detect the condition of the eye bolt automatically. The high accuracy in the experimental results suggests that the method proposed can improve the efficiency of the preventive maintenance routine performed on eye bolts, and, consequently, increase the reliability of the power distribution systems.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the design of a smart directive antenna array used to concentrate and point the radiation beam toward a desired direction. The design is especially aimed at supervision systems of electric power distribution switches with the objective to replace the vertical arrays of electric dipoles commonly used by electric power distribution companies. Simulation and experimental results have demonstrated the proposed four Yagi-Uda antenna array performs well when compared to an array of four vertical folded dipoles.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Phased Array applications have become increasingly
popular with the use of programmable attenuators and phase
shifters. One application is to use phased arrays to increase
the power density between radio stations in network without
having to increase the total signal strength. This is a particularly
important scenario in a smart grid. However, in this application
the phased array system needs some heuristics to synchronize
the phase and attenuation adjustments with the transmission to
propagate the signal with the desired power density and direction.
The phased array control heuristic depends heavily on the type
of transmission and protocols used. This work presents phased
array control for a digital TCP/IP based radio system used in
smart grids. The system intercepts TCP/IP packets from master
terminal unit (MTU) addressed to a specific remote terminal
unit (RTU), checks the RTU?s address, adjusts the phased array
parameters to maximize the RF power density in the direction
of the desired RTU and establishes a connection to the remote
station. Measurements of the system?s performance are presented
in the results section. They showed that the proposed system is
able to perform reconfigurations in an antenna array system in
time intervals about 50ms.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Torres estaiadas são estruturas utilizadas no suporte de linhas aéreas de transmissão de energia elétrica cuja fixação ao solo utiliza hastes de ancoragem. Estas âncoras podem apresentar corrosão, ocasionada pelas intempéries ambientais ou falhas de instalação, cujo rompimento pode levar à queda da torre e consequente interrupção do fornecimento de energia. Um sistema inteligente preditivo foi desenvolvido para diagnóstico das âncoras, em substituição à onerosa técnica de inspeção visual atualmente empregada pelas empresas transmissoras. Este sistema, embarcado em uma maleta industrial, é composto por hardware e software proprietário, e apresenta acurácia superior a 80% para testes realizados em hastes operacionais.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Cable-stayed towers are structures used to support overhead power transmission lines whose attachment to the ground uses anchor rods. These anchors may corrode, caused by bad weather or installation failures, whose rupture can lead to the tower falling and consequent interruption of the energy supply. An intelligent predictive system was developed for diagnosing anchors, replacing the costly visual inspection technique currently used by transmission companies. This system, embedded in an industrial case, is composed of proprietary hardware and software, and has an accuracy of over 80% for tests performed on operational rods.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ALMEIDA, R. J. F. P. V.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A smart antenna array is a system that combines an antenna array and digital signal processing algorithms to change its radiation pattern to achieve a specific goal. Switched arrays can change their parameters to achieve a fixed and predefined number of radiation patterns. By properly choosing a set of amplitudes and phases for the antenna feeds, it is possible to
form a radiation pattern with one or more lobes pointing in
desired directions. In this paper, one proposes a general
optimization scheme and its aspects to obtain precoded phases and amplitude feeds for an arbitrary topology through
evolutionary computing and electromagnetic simulation software. A real application case is here presented for a supervising network of electric power distribution grid using a
smart antenna array with Yagi-Uda antennas. Three different
optimization algorithms were selected and compared (Evolutionary Strategy, Genetic Algorithm and Particle Swarm Optimization)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This article presents four Frequency Selective Surfaces (FSS) with double square loops geometry to be used in an Instantaneous Frequency Measurement (IFM) system. The proposed FSSs have a frequency response based on balanced Gray code, corresponding to the characteristics of frequency discriminators. Unlike traditional Gray code, it is possible to use only dual-band resonators instead of quadriband, simplifying the system and improving the response. A 4-bit IFM system is shown with a resolution of approximately 140 MHz, containing 16 distinct frequency sub-bands between 0.7 and 3 GHz. Finally, spectral occupancy levels are measured in the upper UHF frequency range to verify the applicability of the proposed system. Simulations in CST software and measurements of insertion parameters are presented and compared with

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Microwave filters are essential for filtering and selecting frequencies. They prevent interference, enhance signal quality, and maximize the efficiency of microwave systems. They are widely employed in wireless communications, satellites, and radar systems. To optimize the design of these filters, techniques like machine learning can be utilized, saving time and resources compared to simulations. Machine learning learns from data to discover optimized solutions more swiftly and efficiently, leading to high-performance filters. In this work, analyses of the parameters of a T-inverted filter were performed to serve as a foundation for a machine learning-based design. The filter used was designed and manufactured for a frequency range of 1 GHz to 3 GHz and its measured and simulated results were compared as a way of validating the structure.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Microwave filters are essential for filtering and selecting frequencies. The filter used was designed and manufactured for a frequency range of 1 GHz to 3 GHz and its measured and simulated results were compared as a way of validating the structure.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NOVO, LAURO R. G. S. LOURENÇO

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Eyebolts are metal parts used to support mechanical efforts of heavy structures. These eyebolts may present material loss, either through abrasion or corrosive processes on their surface. Detecting this undesirable condition requires the use of systems which applies non-destructive techniques, since the eyebolt is embedded in concrete. A previous detection system was developed by the authors where its response requires greater sensitivity. This article presents the computational design of a band-pass filter from a microstrip resonator to reduce mismatching losses at the experiment input and the measuring instrument. The designed filter has presented satisfactory results as an adapter for the fault detection system. The simulation results of the fault detection system has presented different responses for distinct eyebolt samples, and thus enabling the desired classifying of them.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Eyebolts are metal parts used to support mechanical efforts of heavy structures. These eyebolts may present material loss, either through abrasion or corrosive processes on their surface. Detecting this undesirable condition requires the use of systems which applies non-destructive techniques, since the eyebolt is embedded in concrete. A previous detection system was developed by the authors where its response requires greater sensitivity. This article presents the computational design of a band-pass filter from a microstrip resonator to reduce mismatching losses at the experiment input and the measuring instrument. The designed filter has presented satisfactory results as an adapter for the fault detection system. The simulation results of the fault detection system has presented different responses for distinct eyebolt samples, and thus enabling the desired classifying of them.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Optimizing antenna arrays for beamforming and also beamsteering comprises to determine the optimal electromagnetic parameters for the antennas feeding. The primary goal is to focus the main lobe towards the desired directions while minimizing energy losses in the undesired ones. In this research, two evolutionary algorithms, namely Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) and Evolution Strategies (ES), were applied to optimize a four-element Yagi-Uda antenna array. The results demonstrate the robustness and feasibility of both algorithms for this application, whose the best algorithm depends on the requirements. While PSO exhibits superior accuracy, ES provides a faster estimation way.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Optimizing antenna arrays for beamforming and also beamsteering comprises to determine the optimal electromagnetic parameters for the antennas feeding. The primary goal is to focus the main lobe towards the desired directions while minimizing energy losses in the undesired ones. In this research, two evolutionary algorithms, namely Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) and Evolution Strategies (ES), were applied to optimize a four-element Yagi-Uda antenna array. The results demonstrate the robustness and feasibility of both algorithms for this application, whose the best algorithm depends on the requirements. While PSO exhibits superior accuracy, ES provides a faster estimation way.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Gain Optimization of Yagi-Uda Antenna Arrays for Customizing Services in 5G Frequencies

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Lauro R. G. S. L. Novo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A demanda crescente por conectividade móvel de alta velocidade impulsiona o desenvolvimento do 5G e a necessidade de antenas inteligentes. Este estudo realiza uma análise comparativa entre dois algoritmos de otimização, a estratégia evolutiva (ES) e a otimização por enxame de partículas (PSO), aplicados a arranjos de antenas Yagi-Uda com cinco elementos para customização do downlink em serviço 5G. A pesquisa foca na viabilidade desses algoritmos para otimizar a excitação eletromagnética dos arranjos, com o objetivo de melhorar a capacidade, o alcance e a qualidade dos sinais transmitidos e recebidos, especialmente em ambientes urbanos densos, promovendo avanços na conectividade e nos serviços móveis. Ambos os algoritmos apresentaram resultados satisfatórios na otimização, contudo, o PSO demonstrou melhor acurácia e estabilidade mais rápida, conforme o aumento no número de simulações.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The growing demand for high-speed mobile connectivity is driving the development of 5G and the need for smart antennas. This study performs a comparative analysis between two optimization algorithms, the evolutionary strategy (ES) and the particle swarm optimization (PSO), applied to five-element Yagi-Uda antenna arrays for downlink customization in 5G service. The research focuses on the feasibility of these algorithms to optimize the electromagnetic excitation of the arrays, with the aim of improving the capacity, range, and quality of transmitted and received signals, especially in dense urban environments, promoting advances in connectivity and mobile services. Both algorithms presented satisfactory results in the optimization; however, the PSO demonstrated better accuracy and faster stability, as the number of simulations increased.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Neste artigo é apresentada a análise de uma superfície
seletiva em frequência, FSS, passa-faixa, com dupla camada de
metalização, sendo uma camada com geometia matrioska e a
outra uma espira quadrada. A utilização de apenas uma camada
de substrato reduz o volume, assim como facilita o processo de
fabricação, pois evita o uso de espaçadores. Por outro lado, a
espira quadrada permite o ajuste da resposta em frequência,
suprimindo ressonâncias indesejadas. A obtenção da geometria
matrioska é descrita passo a passo, sendo também propostas
equações que fornecem o valor inicial da sua frequência de
ressonância. Numericamente, FSS com as geometrias matrioska e
espira quadrada são analisadas separadamente. Em seguida, as
duas geometrias são colocadas em faces opostas de um mesmo
substrato e a FSS resultante analisada. Os resultados numéricos
consideraram as polarizações x e y, com ângulos de incidência
variando de 0º até 50°. As equações iniciais de projeto propostas
apresentaram resultados adequados, indicando a aplicabilidade
dessas equações. Os resultados numéricos confirmaram a resposta
em frequência esperada, com independência da polarização e
estabilidade do ângulo de incidência.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article presents the analysis of a frequency-selective surface, FSS, band-pass, with a double metallization layer, one layer with a matryoshka geometry and the other with a square loop. The use of only one layer of substrate reduces the volume, as well as facilitating the manufacturing process, since it avoids the use of spacers. On the other hand, the square loop allows the frequency response to be adjusted, suppressing unwanted resonances. The process of obtaining the matryoshka geometry is described step by step, and equations that provide the initial value of its resonance frequency are also proposed. Numerically, FSS with the matryoshka and square loop geometries are analyzed separately. Then, the two geometries are placed on opposite faces of the same substrate and the resulting FSS is analyzed. The numerical results considered the x and y polarizations, with incidence angles ranging from 0º to 50º. The initial proposed design equations presented adequate results, indicating the applicability of these equations. The numerical results confirmed the expected frequency response, with polarization independence and incidence angle stability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of a Linear Modified Yagi-Uda array using Particle Swarm Optimization for the Radiation Pattern Synthesis
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Analysis of a Linear Modified Yagi-Uda array using Particle Swarm Optimization for the Radiation Pattern Synthesis

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: DE ALMEIDA, R. J. F. P. V.
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: DE ALMEIDA, R. J. F. P. V.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: : This work analyzes a modified linear smart antenna array that uses the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) method to maximize the main lobe while minimizes the sidelobes. The antenna array is composed of four commercial Yagi-Uda antennas and is said to be modified in the sense that the two extreme antennas are tilted sideways at 70° while the other two remain parallel to each other. The electrical feeds of the antennas, phase and amplitude, are the only parameters to be optimized. An electronically smart antenna was designed, simulated, built and tested. Simulated and measured radiation pattern results are here reported.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: : This work analyzes a modified linear smart antenna array that uses the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) method to maximize the main lobe while minimizes the sidelobes. The antenna array is composed of four commercial Yagi-Uda antennas and is said to be modified in the sense that the two extreme antennas are tilted sideways at 70° while the other two remain parallel to each other. The electrical feeds of the antennas, phase and amplitude, are the only parameters to be optimized. An electronically smart antenna was designed, simulated, built and tested. Simulated and measured radiation pattern results are here reported.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Effects of substitution of CuO by NiS on the superconductivity in YBa2Cu3O7â¿¿Î´
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Effects of substitution of CuO by NiS on the superconductivity in YBa2Cu3O7â¿¿Î´

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de Aparelhos e Equipamentos de Telecomunicação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The effect of the substitution of CuO by NiS on superconductivity in YBa2Cu3O7-delta are analysed. The resonating-valence-bond theory predict an increased Tc due to the great number of the unsynchronized resonances generated as the insulating CuO is substituting by NiO. A set of samples with nominal composition YB2CuO1-xNiSx3Oy. Prepared for caparison shows only a little bit increase in Tc for small substitution of CuO by NiS. The room temperature resistivityy until it reaches that of undopped samples for x=0.05, and the samples with x=0.2 presents a room temperature resistivity factor of 1.5 higher then the undopped sample. In the normal state all the samples discussed exhibit a metallic type behaviour for the electrical resistivity. We suggest that the Tc behaviour is due to the structural deformations introduced by NiS which increase the amount of scattering of the holes by phonons and contribute to the decrease in Tc.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Structural ordering and chemical stability of a complex perovskite oxide DyBa 2 ZrO 5.5 with YBa 2 Cu 3 O 7-δ superconductors
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Structural ordering and chemical stability of a complex perovskite oxide DyBa 2 ZrO 5.5 with YBa 2 Cu 3 O 7-δ superconductors

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A complex perovskite oxide DyBa2ZrO5.5 has been synthesized by solid state reaction. Structural ordering in this material has been studied by x-ray diffraction XRD technique. The XRD spectra reveals that DyBa2ZrO5.5 has an ordered complex cubic perovskite structure. Presence of superstructure reflections in the XRD spectra are signature of A2BBO6 type crystalline structure. Chemical stability of DyBa2ZrO5.5 with YBa2CuO7-d YBCO superconductor has been studied by XRD and electrical resistivity measurements. These studies show that DyBa2ZrO5.5 is chemically stable with YBCO and there is no degradation in the superconducting transition temperature Tc of YBCO even when mixed up to 1:1 vol., with DyBa2ZrO5.5 in YBCO. Detailed study of the superconducting transition region show that : Tc onset and Tc0 values of pure YBCO and YBCO - DyBa2ZrO5.5 composites are similar in both the cases. The implications are discussed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A complex perovskite oxide DyBa2ZrO5.5 has been synthesized by solid state reaction. Structural ordering in this material has been studied by x-ray diffraction XRD technique. The XRD spectra reveals that DyBa2ZrO5.5 has an ordered complex cubic perovskite structure. Presence of superstructure reflections in the XRD spectra are signature of A2BBO6 type crystalline structure. Chemical stability of DyBa2ZrO5.5 with YBa2CuO7-d YBCO superconductor has been studied by XRD and electrical resistivity measurements. These studies show that DyBa2ZrO5.5 is chemically stable with YBCO and there is no degradation in the superconducting transition temperature Tc of YBCO even when mixed up to 1:1 vol., with DyBa2ZrO5.5 in YBCO. Detailed study of the superconducting transition region show that : Tc onset and Tc0 values of pure YBCO and YBCO - DyBa2ZrO5.5 composites are similar in both the cases. The implications are discussed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Study of the Linear Microwave Absorption in YBa2Cu3O7â¿¿Î´ Ceramic Samples for Low Level of Incident Power

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The temperature dependence ( 35K £ T £ 105K ) of direct microwave absorption is studied as a function of incident microwave power up to 30 mW, for a highly compacted ceramic samples of YBa2Cu3O7-d. It is observed that the microwave absorption, under zero dc-field, reveals a strong cavity resonant frequency shift as a function of the incident power for temperatures in the superconducting transition region. The absorption presents a linear behavior with the incident microwave power in both normal and superconducting states. From these measurements the temperature dependence of surface resistance is also obtained.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The temperature dependence ( 35K £ T £ 105K ) of direct microwave absorption is studied as a function of incident microwave power up to 30 mW, for a highly compacted ceramic samples of YBa2Cu3O7-d. The absorption presents a linear behavior with the incident microwave power in both normal and superconducting states. From these measurements the temperature dependence of surface resistance is also obtained.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper describes a complementary method for determining dielectric properties of granular materials using the Transmission/Reflection Method in order to estimate their moisture content. The Newton's Complex Interactive Method is used here as a numerical tool to calculate the complex permittivity of the plaster glue material. Results for samples with moisture contents of 35%, 40% and 45% in the range of 100 MHz to 3 GHz are presented.
